Common base class for all non-exit exceptions.

ComposaPy.DataFlow.models.EXTERNAL_INPUT_NAMES = ['External String Input', 'External Line Input', 'External Private Input', 'External Int Input',...¶
class ComposaPy.DataFlow.models.Input(contract: CompAnalytics.Contracts.ModuleInput)¶

Wraps ModuleIn contract for a simplified textual user interface.

contract :CompAnalytics.Contracts.ModuleInput¶
property value(self) → any¶

Returns the contract member, ValueObj (value).

class ComposaPy.DataFlow.models.Result(contract: CompAnalytics.Contracts.ModuleOutput)¶

Wraps ModuleOut contract for a simplified textual user interface.

contract :CompAnalytics.Contracts.ModuleOutput¶
property value(self) → any¶

Returns the contract member, ValueObj (value).

class ComposaPy.DataFlow.models.Module(contract: CompAnalytics.Contracts.Module)¶

The object representation of a module inside a dataflow object.

contract :CompAnalytics.Contracts.Module¶
property name(self) → str¶

Returns the module name.

property inputs(self) → dict[int, Input]¶

Maps each module input, by name, to a corresponding Input object.

class ComposaPy.DataFlow.models.ResultModule(contract: CompAnalytics.Contracts.Module)¶

Bases: Module

Extends Module to give the ability to retrieve module results.

property results(self) → dict[int, Result]¶

Maps each module result, by name, to a corresponding Result object.

property result(self) → any¶

Convenience property that gets the first result.value from results. Cannot be used if there is more than one result.

class ComposaPy.DataFlow.models.ModuleRunSet(modules: tuple[Module] | tuple[ResultModule])¶

Wrapper for objects with parent Module, for convenience methods on the set of items contained with self._modules.

_modules :tuple[Module] | tuple[ResultModule]¶
__len__(self)¶
__getitem__(self, index)¶
__iter__(self)¶
first(self)¶

Returns first module in self._modules.

first_with_name(self, name)¶

Matches by first module in self._modules with given name.

class ComposaPy.DataFlow.models.RunSet(contract: CompAnalytics.Contracts.Application)¶

Similar to a DataFlowObject, with a couple of differences. The first difference is that every RunSet has an id, where as a DataFlowObject only has an ID if it is saved. The second difference is that the modules property on a RunSet returns ModuleRunSet<ResultModule> instead of ModuleRunSet<Module>, which has the additional functionality of viewing module results.

contract :CompAnalytics.Contracts.Application¶
property id(self) → int¶

Returns the id of dataflow run. Every RunSet is guaranteed to have an id with non-null value.

property modules(self) → ModuleRunSet¶

A ModuleRunSet made up of ResultModule’s.

class ComposaPy.DataFlow.models.DataFlowObject(contract: CompAnalytics.Contracts.Application, service: CompAnalytics.IServices.IApplicationService)¶

Bases: CompAnalytics.Contracts.Application

DataFlowObject can be used to both model and save dataflow configurations, both saved and before saving. Holds a reference to the service needed to carry out operations on it’s behalf.

contract :CompAnalytics.Contracts.Application¶
_service :CompAnalytics.IServices.IApplicationService¶
property id(self) → Optional[int]¶

The contract id. An unsaved DataFlowObject’s id property is None.

property modules(self) → ModuleRunSet¶

A ModuleRunSet made up of Module’s.

save(self) → DataFlowObject¶

Saves the contract representation of DataFlowObject, uses server response as the newly updated contract object (for instance, saving an unsaved contract will give it an id).

run(self, external_inputs: dict[str, any] = None) → RunSet¶

Runs the dataflow represented by contained contract. Any external modules (external int, table, file) that require outside input to run can be added using a dictionary with the module input’s name and corresponding contract.

ComposaPy.DataFlow.models._overwrite_module_inputs(external_inputs: dict[str, any], module: CompAnalytics.Contracts.Module) → None¶
ComposaPy.DataFlow.models._update_module_valueobj(external_inputs: dict[str, any], module: CompAnalytics.Contracts.Module, module_input) → None¶
